{"step_by_step_thinking": "Impression materials are used in dentistry to create a detailed replica of the teeth and oral tissues. Agar is a reversible hydrocolloid impression material that does not require a hardener. Alginate is an irreversible hydrocolloid and also does not require a hardener. Impression compound is a thermoplastic material, which also does not require a hardener. Elastomers, on the other hand, are rubber-like materials that often require a hardener or catalyst to initiate the setting reaction.", "answer_choice": "C. Elastomers"}
